caption: Table 3.1: Hedge algorithm with k best-action queries
description: This table presents the Hedge algorithm, which incorporates best-action queries. The algorithm uses a learning rate (η) that depends on the number of queries and the time horizon.  It combines Hedge's weights with a uniform query selection strategy. If a query is issued at time t, the algorithm selects the best action; otherwise, it samples an action probabilistically from the updated weights. This is then used for the proof of the minimax regret bounds in the full feedback case with best-action queries.
